wikipedia_page.main: Philip Braham (18 June 1881 – 2 May 1934) was an English composer of the early twentieth century, chiefly associated with theatrical work.  From 1914, he composed music for such musicals and revues as Theodore & Co (1916) and London Calling! (1923), including several revues produced by André Charlot.  His best-known song is "Limehouse Blues," which has been recorded by many artists.  He wrote for film in the 1930s.
